history.content:
If you are a current student then there is no cost for ordering an official transcript. Reference

The unofficial one is usually fine for companies. If they want an official one, they'll usually specify that. I've recruited for the past 3 recruiting seasons and I've never had any issues with giving them unofficial transcripts.

If you are a current student then there is no cost for ordering an official transcript. Reference: http://registrar.berkeley.edu/Records/transcripts.html

The unofficial one is usually fine for companies. If they want an official one, they'll usually specify that. I've recruited for the past 3 recruiting seasons and I've never had any issues with giving them unofficial transcripts.

I believe it does cost you ($3 if i remember correctly) to get an official transcript.

The unofficial one is usually fine for companies. If they want an official one, they'll usually specify that. I've recruited for the past 3 recruiting seasons and I've never had any issues with giving them unofficial transcripts.

Is there any way for me to get an official copy of my transcript in PDF form? I'm applying for internships, and some places ask for that. 

I found where on BearFacts I can order order transcripts under "Transcript Request," but it asks for an actual physical address there, not an email address. 

Also, does it cost anything for me to have an official transcript sent somewhere?

Can it be good enough to just provide a pdf of my unofficial transcript?
history.subject: Official PDF Transcript
